The term life support refers to various equipment and medications that are used to keep a patient alive during a critical health condition. In many cases, life support is required when the cardiovascular system, gastrointestinal system, respiratory system or renal system of a patient fails to function. The cost of life support varies based on the machines and other accessories that are being used for the service. On an average, keeping a patient on life support can cost $2000 to $3000 per day.
